suite.name: oFono
suite.description:
1, you can use real network for those cases which had  information (in real network)in description.

2, For most case we have to use simulator to test UI

3, Phonesim is for developer but will be good help for debugging

4, you have to use script to connect your modem or simulator: ./test-modem power, test-modem online

   also you need modify the configration file /etc/ofono/modem.conf as following:

   [phonesim]
   Driver=phonesim
   Address=127.0.0.1
   Port=12345
 5, if you use modem you need modify the configration file like above

6, you should start ofonod first : ofonod -n -d '*'

7, you power on you modem :  ./test-modem poweron, test-modem online

set.name: emergency_call
set.description: cases for emergency telephony

set.name: call_history
set.description:
In MeeGo image, the call history information will be handled by application storage.

So we need check ofonod log about the call history information.

./ofonod -n -d '*'

moreover, there was some cache data in /var/cache/callhistory

set.name: sms_history
set.description:
In MeeGo image, the sms history information will be handled by application storage.

So we need check ofonod log about the sms history information.

./ofonod -n -d '*'

moreover, there was some cache data in /var/cache/smshistory

set.name: gsm_string
set.description: test cases for gsm_string

set.name: aoc
set.description: Advanced of charge

set.name: ussd
set.description: unstructure supplementary service data

set.name: gprs
set.description:
1) you need test it on real network so plug in modem

2) create context first : ./test-gprs createcontext

3)active context: ./test-gprs activecontext

you can use list-contexts to check the detail properties for each step

set.name: ppp
set.description: PPP  application test case

set.name: radio_setting
set.description:
1, it need specail modem to test this feature

2, option modem would be a good one

3,also it dpended on the network for setting,eg: gsm, umts, lte.

set.name: display_text
set.description: This command is used to display text on screen. A high priority is available, to replace anything else on screen (except in case of an emergency call, call presentation or call establishment). The text can be cleared by user or after the expiration of a time-out value (no answer from user). This timer value can be specified in the pro active SIM command

set.name: select_item
set.description: This command makes it possible for the SIM to send a list of items to be displayed by ME and ask the user to select one of these items. A list item is defined by a specific Id number and an associated text to be displayed.

set.name: launguage_notification
set.description: This command sends to the ME the current language used in the SIM devices for displaying text. It may be used in ME to avoid mixed of language for example in case of Display Text commands

set.name: tone
set.description: Play of a standard supervisory tone Required with an “Alpha identifier” provided and with a “Duration” longer enough for the display

set.name: send_dtmf
set.description: This command  Requireds the ME to send a DTMF string after a call has been successfully established, either by the proactive command SET UP CALL or by the user. It is independent of sending DTMF within the set up call. The DTMF digits must not be played locally to the user by ME.

set.name: get_input
set.description: This command Requireds the ME to display text and/or an icon,The characters entered by user can be masked (then a star * character can be displayed instead) according to the command qualifier byte (see the following command detail byte specification). The response length can be any value between 0x00 and 0xFF

set.name: get_inkey
set.description: This command sends text to be displayed and Requireds a single character answer in return. It is intended to allow a dialogue between the SIM and the user, particularly for selecting an option from the menu, the character entered is not displayed (a * character can however be echoed on screen), and cannot be changed, the character is directly

set.name: send_sms
set.description: This command Requireds the terminal equipment to send a Short Message.

set.name: send_ss
set.description: This command makes it possible for the SIM to Required ME to send a SS string.

set.name: send_ussd
set.description: This command makes it possible for the SIM to Required ME to send a ussd string.

set.name: setup_menu
set.description: This command makes it possible for the SIM to Required ME to set up a menu item

set.name: launch_browser
set.description: This command makes it possible for the SIM to Required ME to launch browser

set.name: modem_emulator
set.description:
precondition:

1, launch test server which will simulate the atserver.  You will get the serial port information like /dev/pts/5

2, modify the minicom configration:  set serail port as /dev/pts/5

set.name: networking
set.description: oFono cases for networking feature
